You have wonderful views of Laguna Beach, the local coves, and on a clear day you can see Catalina Island off in the distance.

There are plenty of benches to use to relax and admire the views.

Plenty of lovely plantings. You can spot hummingbirds flitting about the flowered plants.

This is a beautiful hidden beach. All of the shells and rocks are protected, so no collecting! Excellent tide pools to explore and plenty of beautiful sand on this little stretch of beach.
This is a very nice park to watch the sunset and walk through the pathways and the luxurious vegetation.
Love this park. Take a walk, have lunch at Las Brisas, and stop in at the Laguna Art Museum. Make sure you take a picture by the whale.

good for family and friends. go here to get sun and fun. I would lke to express symathy for rest of country

Great place to people watch, enjoy the views and see Laguna Beach at it's best. Our hotel was steps away and we spent time in Heisler Park every day. Don't miss this gem.
Fabulous views of the beaches, well kept walkways and numerous look outs. Gorgeous!!! Many areas have beach access.
When in Laguna Beach, walk along the promenade from Heisler Park to the Main Beach. The views are amazing. The atmosphere before sunset is especially enjoyable.

The long park by the water was exquisitely landscaped with both plants and sculptures. I recommend you download the walking tour so you know what you're seeing. Walk near then beach then back into town via gallery row.
Beautiful beach with many nice views
Beautiful beach with many nice views, beach access points, places for children and adults to play and relax. Prefecty located next to our hotel.

I’ve been coming to Laguna Beach for years as it’s one of my favorite beaches in SoCal. What I love most is coming to Heisler Park just before sunset. There are metered parking spaces at a reasonable cost and on a recent Saturday we had no trouble finding a space. Summer months it gets crowded so you’ll have to come early. This park is located on the hillsides of Laguna overlooking the beach. There are picnic areas with built in bbqs for families and lots of different walkways and stairs that will lead you to the beach should you choose to go down. Every spot in Heisler Park offers a breathtaking view so be sure to have your camera or phone charged. Bring a towel in case you wander down to the rocks where there are small tide pools. Or just sit and enjoy the beauty of the sunset. You’ll likely come across couples taking engagement photos or bridal parties. The gazebos offer Tahitian like photos and you’ll find it hard to resist not wanting to come back here time and time again.

Notorious views to rival Mallorca? Diving, picnics and long walks and photography are possible here.

Heisler is notorious among locals and the diving community in Laguna Beach. The walk ways have an artistic flair and the societal views (Laguna Beach Lux) are reminiscent of fine white sands at S'Arenal on the Island of Mallorca in Spain.

At this location Heisler offers a long walk to shore for the divers and up close parking---metered---is a plus for not having to lug dive, picnic or beach gear too far. Coffee and light snacks like Madison Gardens are within walking distance.

Heisler delights pedestrians, artists and tourists with its unique benches, sculptures, ocean views, rocky shores and pristine tide pools. Restrooms are close and shops in Laguna Beach are of note for "one of a kind" shopping adventures. Visit!

If Gazebos could talk this one in Heisler Park would brag about all of the families, friends, and couples who have enjoyed fond memories at this vista with gorgeous views. When traveling to Laguna Beach a stroll through Heisler Park is a must to enjoy a beautiful part of southern California coastline.

This park set atop a cliff is an amazing guy place to walk, admire panoramic views of the Pacific Ocean (especially at sunset), while appreciating beautiful flowers and statues integrated so well into the landscape. If you are in Laguna Beach make sure to take 30 minutes to an hour to visit...or bring your picnic lunch or take-out dinner as the park has several picnic tables!

Heisler Park is a beautiful park in Laguna, with a great picnic and grassy area for having an outdoor gathering with friends and family, and then the beach down below is an excellent place to get your feet wet and spend a few hours playing in the sand. There are lots of rocks surrounding the beach, and its fun to explore the tide pools and see all of the crabs and small fish. The bathroom facility here is nice and clean. Parking meters nearby charge $2.50 per hour, and they do accept credit cards.

Visited Heisler on 08/10/17. Arrived around 11 am and found metered, 2 hour parking. Walked down to the beach and easily found an area to put our stuff on the sand. I wasn't expecting to go in the ocean because I have always heard it is too cold without a wetsuit. I will admit the water was cold but I easily adjusted and jumped waves for 90 minutes. It was a blast! People were also snorkeling and paddle boarding. You have to be a little careful swimming because some waves can be strong and there are rocks. Also there was some seaweed so don't freak out if some touches your legs. It is not a sea creature trying to get you. The bath rooms looked much nicer than most beach locations and there were two outside showers you can use to rinse off. I can't speak highly enough of the beauty of this place!

Since Laguna Beach was en route, I decided we would stop there to see the Pacific and walk along the beach. I searched TripAdvisor for a good location and selected Heisler Park based on the rating. It was the perfect site for a two hour visit.

The park sits atop the bluffs and offers stunning views of the coastline. The walking paths are easily accessible and lined with beds of beautiful flowers and plants. The public restrooms were well-kept and convenient. The walking path led to the public beach at the base of the bluff. We took off our shoes and walked up and down the beach with the sunshine and breeze in our faces. Heisler Park was a picturesque and practical place to experience the Pacific and get a taste of the Southern California lifestyle.

This was our first visit to Heisler Park in Laguna Beach, and we were just knocked out by the ocean views. The walking trail is broad and comfortable, with easy footing for all ages. We discovered there is plenty of metered parking on a street alongside the trail. There's little or no signage we could see to lead us into the park from the Pacific Coast Highway, but once on the trail we saw that there is a small side street, Jasmine, that cuts into the main drag. By turning west on Jasmine, you will connect with Cliff Street and a row of parking spaces. On a weekday morning, there were many openings. This is a great trail for all ages and appears to be accessible to disabled people and frail elders. The only physical challenge is the steep stairway leading down to the city beach at the south end of the park. We're already looking forward to next year's visit and perhaps a stop for coffee or lunch at one of the cute little places in the tiny downtown nearby. Meanwhile, the awesome views will stay in our minds to refresh us throughout the year.

We were staying at The Inn at Laguna Beach and visiting Heisler Park (adjacent to The Inn) was one of the first things we did after arriving. The oceanfront park is beautifully landscaped and maintained. There are grassy areas, numerous spots for beach access, clean bathrooms, and picnic tables with small grills for cooking. The walk is very relaxing and not too challenging, but still enough to give you healthy activity. On the day we were there, there were people running, walking their dogs, taking photos and strolling through, taking in the breathtaking beaches and landscaping. Heisler Park is one of the most beautiful and well appointed waterfront Southern California parks I have walked through. Its natural beauty on the shoreline is a must if you go to Laguna Beach and just want to walk or stroll alone or with friends. The city has put a lot of money redoing the park with wonderful art and landscape. There are lots of places to sit, hear music, lie on the grass, go into the surf below and picnic too with lots of tables and benches. They have Lawn Bowling you can watch and also maybe try out, and lots of wonderful private places to be in. The bathrooms are usually clean and its kid and dog friendly. There are no outdoor swing sets, but always spaces to enjoy. They have an unusual and beautiful and very spiritual sculpture by an artist named Jorge Dubin with a piece of the steel from the 911 remains from The NYC World Trade Center. Go there and reflect about life. There are also pieces of art to honor the military. The artwork all over is wonderful, bring a camera because there are lots of things to photograph. Feeling the ocean breeze and sunshine will make you fall in love with Laguna Beach again and again. Enjoy.
